narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: The professor was not familiar with the program software which was what the course was based on. As a result, if there were any problems with the program, she was unable to help.
Readings were well chosen, but lectures could move too fast through the atmospheric science that students were not as familiar with.

I feel very fortunate that this class was offered while I am a student at FES. I think it is a tremendous asset to the school, and I would certainly encourage other students to take the course. Nadine's lectures are very clear and really do start from the very beginning so that non-scientists can take full advantage of the course.I would love to see the course split into two courses, though. I think it would be useful to have a course focused solely on the material covered in lectures--a scientific overview (quite in-depth) of the Earth's climate--and a course focused solely on modeling--which would likely be a more advanced course. The climate model used in the class was fun to use, and the experiments were interesting. I would definitely like to see a course more focused just on modeling, though--there does not seem to be a course like that anywhere at Yale (not in FES, G&G, etc.), and it would truly be an asset for such a course to be based at FES.The choice of papers was also excellent--they were scientific articles, but the quantity and length of the articles was kept to a minimum so that students could easily do all of the reading and understand the content.
Interesting class, good introduction to climate models, helpful and knowledgeable instructor. Very light on the mechanics of the models such as the mathematical treatment, though.
Keep up with the good work!
The subject material is highly relevant.
Using EdGCM

The labs: effective approach to review the uncertainties of climate models through step wise testing of hypotheses. Good way to understand the science and models at the same time. I wish there were more!
We learnt to use EdGCM that is a powerful tool to measure by yourself the global warming scenarios.
The class project and playing around with an actual climate model.
Learning how climate models work. understanding the uncertainties

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: -organization-running the labs and the assignments-use of the program and instruction relating to the program
Better knowledge of program used for labs (edGCM) and how to fix it if it doesn't run properly on student's laptops

The final project is a great idea that could benefit for some additional tweaking. Getting to work with a climate model is a really exciting part of the class. But for the final project, some of the conclusions seem preordained - increasing the CO2 trend will lead to warming, for example, or the model does not have enough resolution to do regional studies. More time with the instructor is needed to come up with interesting ideas that can be modeled. Editing some model parameters will be a more difficult but more intellectually rewarding project.
We should have more support to solve problems that program has. Also we should have TA to learn all the tools that the program has.
Midterm and/or final exam might have been good as incentive to study material.
Maybe we could have benefited from a closer follow up of text book,

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: The course is a technical course, which fits very well with my background.

I was very happy that FES offered this course. Climate modeling is important for anyone interested in climate change to understand since so much of our future understanding is predicated on these models. It is naturally difficult to balance a course between the physical science of climate modeling and educating students interested in policy about climate models. I hope this course continues to be offered so that the instructor can improve the material and students can benefit for learning about this important aspect of climate change.

Climate models link emissions to predicted climate change. It is the latter that matters, not the former in se but it is the easiest variable to manipulate. It is important to understand the limitations and possibilities of climate models to know what position to assume in the emissions space, dominated by energy-related carbon dioxide.

I wanted to get a grasp at how climate models work, I do not plan to become a climate researcher but now I can explain to la people how global warming takes place and what ae the most important variables.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Do not take this course if you do not have at least two computers. Many of the assignments needed to run for over three days on the computer, the professor did not know this. It made doing ANY OTHER WORK ON YOUR COMPUTER IMPOSSIBLE.
A must-take for any student interest in climate change, but manage expectations - don't expect to significantly build your own model.

This course is focused on determining global warming scenarios usingEdGCM, thus extensive use of computers is required.The course allows to determine by yourself scenarios of concentration not only using existed data but also you can create your own emissions scenario.
Buy the recommended primer on modeling; it is well worth the investment.
This course is not good for students without extensive physical and atmospheric science background.
Start your simulations days ahead as they take a long time to complete. Start your class project on time.
Read a lot. plan your final assignment soon andbe passionate about it.
